item.title: STALKER 2 To Get First DLC in 2026; Still No News on Multiplayer and Cross-Platform Mods
item.content:encoded:
STALKER 2: Heart of Chornobyl launches today on Sony's PlayStation 5 console, exactly one year after its initial release on PC and Xbox Series S|X, following the end of the timed console exclusivity deal with Microsoft.

We published an interview with GSC Game World focused on the PS5 launch, but we also asked about the content and features that are still to come. Ahead of last year's launch, the Ukrainian studio stated that the game would eventually be updated with features like multiplayer, cross-platform mods, and hardware-accelerated ray tracing. However, twelve months later, there is still no news to share on that front. However, we did get confirmation that the first STALKER 2 DLC will launch at some point in 2026. As a reminder, the game's Ultimate Edition is still being sold with the promise that its Season Pass would include 'two future expansions and all upcoming DLCs'.

We also inquired about the announced upgrade to a newer version of Epic's Unreal Engine 5.

Zakhar Bocharov: Switching to a new version of Unreal Engine 5 is a very big task, which is exactly why even in our roadmap we especially noted that we cannot guarantee the exact timing. It should bring a significant boost to optimization overall, but we will keep you updated on the timing of this update through our socials. But here I would like to note that update 1.7 has already delivered a significant and very noticeable optimization gain, and it is available right now.

Finally, we wanted to know if GSC Game World was satisfied with the performance of STALKER 2 so far.

Zakhar Bocharov: One million copies sold in under three days and several million players through Game Pass on PC and Xbox can undoubtedly be considered successful figures. Over the year, the game received 7 major updates — and far more smaller ones — which not only improved performance but also added new content. The game is now significantly different from what it was at launch. Updates are a complex matter. In the world of S.T.A.L.K.E.R., they could probably go on forever, much like the pursuit of perfection. Nevertheless, they will continue forward on.

Have you played STALKER 2 on PC or Xbox, or do you plan to purchase it on PlayStation 5? In the former case, please share your opinion on this long-awaited sequel in the comments.

Follow Wccftech on Google to get more of our news coverage in your feeds.



https://wccftech.com/stalker-2-first-dlc-in-2026-no-news-multiplayer-cross-platform-mods/

item.title: Seagate’s External Hard Drive Drops to a New Record Low, Amazon Clears Out the 4TB Option
item.content:encoded:
Amazon kicked off Black Friday by dropping the Seagate 4TB external hard drive to a record low of $99, down from its usual $124 price. External storage solves the constant problem of running out of space on laptops, game consoles and desktops without requiring you to open up your machine. This 4TB capacity gives you enough room to store your entire game library, backup your computer multiple times, or archive years of photos and videos. The drive’s universal compatibility with Windows, Mac, Xbox, and PlayStation means you buy it once and use it everywhere without reformatting or compatibility headaches.

See at Amazon

Plug-and-Play Simplicity

The Seagate 4TB HDD doesn’t need any software installation or setup process to get it up and running. You connect the provided 18-inch-long USB 3.0 cable between the drive and your computer, and the OS immediately recognizes it as available storage. Windows users will see the drive pop up in File Explorer; Mac users will find it in Finder; and console gamers can format it via their system settings in roughly 30 seconds. This is true plug-and-play functionality with no troublesome proprietary software, driver downloads, or cumbersome setup wizards.

In theory, the USB 3.0 interface can reach transfer speeds of as high as 5Gbps but realistically, this works out to 100-120MB/s for sequential file transfers. You can back up your entire photo library in the time it takes to make coffee or transfer 4K video footage without waiting around all afternoon. You will be able to copy a 50GB game in about 7-8 minutes. This speed is more than adequate for directly playing games from the drive on either an Xbox or a PlayStation, though load times will be slower compared to internal SSDs.

The compact design measures approximately 4.5 inches long by 3 inches wide and less than an inch thick, so it easily slips into a laptop bag or backpack. Weighing only a few ounces, you hardly know the drive is in the bag when on the move. Finished in matte black to resist fingerprints, it looks professional when plugged into your laptop for home or office use. The rounded edges and smooth surfaces keep the drive from catching on contents inside a bag or scratching other devices. Seagate has engineered the enclosure to shield the internal drive against minor drops and bumps common during normal travel.

The 4TB of capacity offers enough space for around 1,000 hours of HD video, 80,000 high-resolution photos, or around 50 of the latest AAA games. Xbox and PlayStation users are able to install their entire game collections and not have to continuously uninstall titles to make room for new releases. Archive completed projects, store raw footage, or maintain multiple backup versions of important files without running out of space on the drive.

In addition, Seagate bundles the drive with one year of Rescue Service which will help you get your data back in case the drive dies or you accidentally delete some important files. That service alone can save you thousands of dollars compared to paying for professional data recovery out of pocket. With decades of experience in the storage business, the company’s drives power everything from consumer devices to enterprise data centers.

At $99, this Seagate external hard drive costs just 2.4 cents per gigabyte, which is exceptionally good value for reliable branded storage. Amazon’s Black Friday pricing brings the cost down to where buying cloud storage subscriptions for the same capacity would cost more over two years.

See at Amazon



https://kotaku.com/seagates-external-hard-drive-drops-to-a-new-record-low-amazon-clears-out-the-4tb-option-2000645709

item.title: Sonos Ace ANC Headphones Are 2x Cheaper Than AirPods Max, Amazon Clears Out Stock and Wants Them All Gone
item.content:encoded:
Amazon’s stock counter shows fewer than 12 units remaining at the time of writing this article which tells you everything about how fast the Sonos Ace headphones are moving at this Black Friday price. Premium wireless headphones solve the problem of airplane noise, open office chaos and commute soundtrack quality but most flagship models cost a fortune. The Sonos Ace just dropped to its lowest price ever at $279 on Amazon for Black Friday, down from the usual $399, which puts them at roughly half the cost of AirPods Max or Bose Ultra headphones.

See at Amazon

Three-Dimensional Music

The Sonos Ace delivers spatial audio via Dolby Atmos which places instruments and vocals in a three-dimensional soundstage around your head. Dynamic head tracking shifts the audio positioning as you move, so the sound stays anchored to your device rather than rotating with your head. This tech creates an immersive listen that’s almost as if you’re sitting in a recording studio or a concert hall. It works great in those Atmos-mixed tracks on Apple Music or Tidal, where producers have placed elements on purpose in the spatial field.

It’s unusual that Sonos allows for lossless audio streaming over Bluetooth; most wireless headphones tend to compress audio to fit within Bluetooth’s bandwidth limitations. The company also uses USB-C connectivity for true lossless playback when you want absolute audio fidelity. This dual approach means you get convenience when you need it and maximum quality when you’re sitting down for critical listening.

The ANC uses multiple microphones to analyze and neutralize external sounds across a wide frequency range. Sonos engineered the ANC to handle everything from low-frequency airplane engine drone to mid-range conversation noise. It also adjusts in real time to your surroundings, kicking cancellation harder or softer depending on the ambient noise. Transparency mode lets you hear your surroundings when needed, be it airport announcements or quick conversations.

Battery life reaches 30 hours with ANC enabled which means you can fly cross-country multiple times before needing a charge. That endurance puts the Ace ahead of most competitors that struggle to hit 20 hours with noise cancellation running. The rapid charging feature gives you three hours of playback from just three minutes plugged in, saving you when you forgot to charge overnight. A full charge takes about three hours via USB-C and the headphones support charging while listening through the cable.

The physical design focuses on all-day comfort: plush memory foam ear cushions are wrapped in soft vegan leather. Sonos shaped the headband and earcups to adapt to various head shapes, hairstyles, and even accessories such as glasses without causing pressure points. An adjustable headband extends smoothly to find that just-right fit, while earcups rotate to keep up with the angle of your head.

At $279, the Sonos Ace costs roughly half what you’d pay for AirPods Max or Bose Ultra headphones and delivers comparable or superior features in several areas. The fact that Amazon has fewer than 12 units left at this record low price suggests other people have already figured out this value equation.

See at Amazon



https://kotaku.com/sonos-ace-anc-headphones-are-2x-cheaper-than-airpods-max-amazon-clears-out-stock-and-wants-them-all-gone-2000645672

item.title: Fortnite Chapter 7 Season 1 Battle Pass Leaks Reveal Back to the Future Collab
item.content:encoded:
Leaks continue to flood in for Chapter 7 in Fortnite following a creator preview event held by Epic Games, including some of the items set to be included in the Season 1 Battle Pass.

Chapter 6 in Fortnite draws to a close next week with a big Zero Hour live event, and, following a period of downtime, Chapter 7 kicks off on November 30—and there’s a big collab in store, according to leaks.

Leaks Say Marty McFly Skin Coming to Fortnite Chapter 7

According to reliable leakers, including ShiinaBR, Marty McFly from the Back to the Future franchise will feature in the Battle Pass for Chapter 7, Season 1, alongside another big collab that Epic Games has already teased.

McFly’s look will be based on the original Back to the Future films, with high-top trainers, sunglasses, and an orange gilet, and his inclusion comes alongside previous links that indicated the iconic DeLorean car will be featured—with the vehicle already appearing in Epic Games’ Rocket League.

Ahead of the new chapter, Epic Games revealed a collab with Kill Bill, with The Bride shown in a trailer for the upcoming live event, and it’s stated that the iconic look, with the yellow tracksuit, will also feature in the Battle Pass.

The two collabs indicate the widespread rumor that Hollywood serves as major inspiration for the Island in Chapter 7, with a ‘Battlewood’ sign on the hills mimicking the famous Hollywood sign already spotted.

This also aligns with previous leaks for Chapter 7, which indicate that both Harry Potter and SpongeBob Squarepants will have collabs during the Chapter.

What collabs do you want to see in Chapter 7 in Fortnite? Share your ideas in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Fortnite, check out the leaks of driveable reboot vans and a bot mode, and take a look at all the quests and rewards in the Party Up – Winter Rush event.

item.title: ARC Raiders November 20 Update & Full 1.3.0 Patch Notes—Venator Nerfed & Rubber Duck Feature Added
item.content:encoded:
Embark Studios is well aware that ARC Raiders is a success. This is why the developer keeps supporting the game with new updates and dropping patch notes like it’s hot. The November 20 ARC Raiders 1.3.0 update drops some big changes that you can’t DUCK.

ARC Raiders is amazing, but it isn’t perfect. This is why Embark Studios nerfed ARC Raiders’ most OP perk not long ago. The changes will keep coming, and improvements will shape ARC into the extraction shooter.

We’ve got everything you need to know about the ARC Raiders 1.3.0 update, featuring full patch notes at the end.

Biggest ARC Raiders November 20 Changes

Various balance changes have rolled out for the value of certain items, specific damage numbers—such as the Venator—have been readjusted, many bugs have been fixed, and there’s even a nice touch for rubber duck fans.

You will need to think twice when selling certain items in ARC Raiders—such as Power Cells and certain ammo—as Embark has rung the changes. ARCs have been weakened to behave slightly more reasonably, and the Venator’s fire rate has been reworked, as it was “over-performing.”

One of the biggest, growing pastimes in ARC Raiders is collecting rubber ducks. While Embark hasn’t stated specifically what the change is, the dev has been listening to your request:

“Your Raider Den has been ducked out.”

All ARC Raiders Patch Notes For November 20 Update 1.3.0

Here’s the complete 1.3.0 patch notes for you to read.

Balance Changes

Items:

Deadline

  • Buy value: From 8,100 to 15,000 Coins
  • Sell value: From 3,000 to 5,000 Coins
  • Crafting:
    • Old: 2 Explosive compound + 1 Synthesized fuel
    • New: 3 Explosive compound + 2 ARC Circuitry 
  • Deadline trader stock: From 3 to 1

Power cell

  • Sell value: From 640 to 270 Coins

Launcher ammo

  • Buy value:
    • Old: 10 launcher ammo for 6,000 Coins
    • New: 6 launcher ammo for 4,500 Coins
  • Sell value: From 200 to 250
  • Crafting:
    • Old: 6 launcher ammo for 4 Metal parts + 1 Explosive Compound
    • New: 6 launcher ammo for 1 ARC Motion Core + 2 Crude Explosives
  • Launcher ammo crafting is available at the Workbench without needing a blueprint.

Venator

Dev note: The fully upgraded Venator has been over-performing recently, capable of outgunning full squads using close range weapons. We’re re-tuning the fire-rate gained from upgrades to pull down the pacing a bit, while still keeping its damage and accuracy intact. This should encourage players to take some more time with their shots rather than mag-dumping the first poor soul they encounter. The community also rightfully pointed out that the weight of the Venator was inconsistent with the weights of our other pistols, so we’ve corrected that as well.

  • Reduced Fire-rate gained from upgrades from 22/44/60% to 13/26/40%.
  • Increased Weight from 2 to 5.

Explosive Damage

Dev note: We noticed that explosives dealt damage to more parts at once than intended, allowing weapons like the Hullcracker to kill larger drones too quickly. We’ve adjusted explosive damage to make it more consistent across the board, and we’ve re-balanced the damage of the Hullcracker to account for that change. This will require Hullcracker shots to need a bit more precision while still dealing good damage to the targeted spot.

  • Rebalanced explosive damage against ARC for a more consistent experience.
  • Explosions on smaller enemies, e.g. Turrets are largely unaffected.
  • Explosions on larger sized enemies, e.g. Bastion will typically deal a bit less damage.

Content and Bug Fixes

ARC

  • Fixed a bug where ARC could call down reinforcements outside the map.
  • Shredder
    • Shredder will now detect and move more reliably towards Lure Grenades.
    • Shredder movement and handling updated: slightly reduced turn speed, improved braking, stiffer suspension, and more consistent reactions to impacts for steadier behavior in combat.
    • Improved Shredder navigation to prevent it from getting stuck on corners when moving toward the player.

Audio 

  • Reduced volume attenuation for explosion tinnitus and concussion effects to improve clarity.

Maps 

  • Barricades can no longer be placed overlapping your character, preventing clipping through walls and access to locked rooms.
  • The Dam Battlegrounds
    • Fixed an issue where players would get stuck in the Dam Control Tower elevator shaft.
  • Spaceport
    • Added collision to the staircase walls and ceiling in the Hidden Bunker on Spaceport.
    • Fixed an issue where players could enter the wall near the Launch Tower ramp on Spaceport, preventing unfair ambushes.
    • Fixed an issue where players could access the locked room on the Control Tower without a key.
  • Blue Gate
    • Fixed railing props on Blue Gate that mistakenly blocked bullets; shots now pass through as expected.
  • Stella Montis
    • Fixed a collision issue on Stella Montis near the Train Station that could cause players to fall through the terrain.
    • Fixed a location in Stella Montis Train Station where players could get stuck.
    • Removed two player spawns on Stella Montis that were too close to ARC spawn areas.
    • Fixed missing visibility collision on walls in the Business Center area of Stella Montis that allowed shots to pass through.

Miscellaneous

  • Fixed a crash when using Raider Voice (proximity chat) on PCs without AVX2 support.
  • Fixed a crash that could occur when surrendering after reconnecting to a session.
  • Fixed an issue where scavenging parts from the Shredder could leave behind invisible collisions.
  • Fixed an issue where the Trials weekly rollover could display an outdated rank; the celebration now reflects the correct current rank and the UI remains accurate during the cooldown period.
  • Updated recommended AMD graphics driver to version 25.11.1 to reduce recent crash issues on AMD GPUs.
  • Your Raider Den has been ducked out.

Movement 

  • Improved enemy ground detection to better handle steep surfaces, reducing erratic movement when traversing angled terrain.

Weapons 

  • Aphelion
    • Fixed an issue where Aphelion tracers could become excessively bright at distance, reducing visibility for the player being shot at.
    • Increased Aphelion blueprint drop rates.
  • Stitcher
    • Corrected player facing stats for the Stitcher, showing incorrect scaling of reload time across upgrade levels.

Big thanks to the official ARC Raiders page for the complete 1.3.0 patch notes.

Have any of these fixes or changes caught your eye? What do you think Embark needs to focus on for the next update? The Insider Gaming Discord Server is where you can share your ideas.

Momotaro Dentetsu 2 opens at 147,513 retail copies sold.

Famitsu has published its estimated physical game software data for Japan for week of November 10, 2025 to November 16, 2025.

Momotaro Dentetsu 2: Anata no Machi mo Kitto Aru – Higashi Nihon Hen + Nishi Nihon Hen was the highest selling new release of the week, debuting at 90,706 copies on Switch and 56,807 copies on Switch 2 for an opening week total of 147,513 retail copies sold.

On the hardware side, Switch 2 sold 101,549 units, the Switch family sold 22,736 units, the PlayStation 5 family sold 5,855 units, the Xbox Series family sold 574 units, and the PlayStation 4 family sold 15 units.

item.title: Otome Daoshi: Fighting for Love launches March 26, 2026 in the west
item.content:encoded:
• Switch

Aksys Games Online Store pre-orders include six keychains.

Idea Factory-developed otome visual novel Otome Daoshi: Fighting for Love will launch for Switch on March 26, 2026 in the west, publisher Aksys Games announced.

An exclusive edition of the game featuring a set of six keychains is available for pre-order now via the the Aksys Games Online Store.

Otome Daoshi: Fighting for Love first launched for Switch on September 26, 2024 in Japan.

Here is an overview of the game, via Aksys Games:

Shunlin lives in the thriving martial arts kingdom of Kayu where she’s a Daoist priestess in training. This year is especially important as the Tournament of Valor will decide the strongest fighter in the country. On the day of the tournament, however, a horde of assailants appears at the arena and attacks the spectators.

Experience the conflict and betrayal amongst allies and confront the challenges ahead. As she struggles alongside her rivals to protect those important to them and their pride, our protagonist fights for her beloved country and for the warrior that she loves! What will be their fate in the end, and what will the future hold?



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/11/otome-daoshi-fighting-for-love-launches-march-26-2026-in-the-west

item.title: Dragon's Dogma 2 player milestone has left many begging for DLC
item.content:encoded:
Capcom has celebrated a new milestone for Dragon's Dogma 2, which came out last year, but the most common response so far is - what about some DLC?

Last night, the Dragon's Dogma 2 team shared the following post across its social media: "Thank you to the four million Arisen around the world! We're grateful to share the immersive fantasy world of Dragon's Dogma 2 with you all, where freedom and adventure await."

To see this content please enable targeting cookies.

Capcom accompanied its post with some Dragon's Dogma 2 artwork proclaiming this player number (see image below), and it is of course a figure worth celebrating. However, fans of the game clearly now want more of the good stuff, and have used this post to voice their desires for some DLC.

"Where's the post release support guys? DLC? A reason to revisit? Feels like you have given up on it," reads one such response. "Please give us any information on if any plans for updates or DLC are in the works. We all are dying to know," adds another. You get the idea.

And after all, the first game in the series got new content after launch via expansion Dark Arisen, which dramatically transformed the game. I was just chatting with our Alex about it, and in his words Dark Arisen "legitimately took the game from like a 7 to a 9/10".

However, there is one key spanner in the works when it comes to new content for Dragon's Dogma 2. The game's director - Hideaki Itsuno - is no longer part of the development team. Itsuno left Capcom after more than 30 years at the studio in August of last year. At this time, he said he hoped to "create fun, beautiful games that are as memorable as, or even more memorable than, the ones I have created so far".

In November last year, it was announced Itsuno was now the head of LightSpeed Japan Studio, a newly-established game developer with a focus on the creation of "original AAA action game titles".

Do you want to see more Dragon's Dogma 2 content? Or, have you accepted it is what it is?

Related topics
